findings.title: Minting of unlimited number of sundae tokens
findings.description: Smart contract can mint NFTs to increase the total supply without any limitation.

findings.title: Potential unauthorized script upgrade
findings.description: The withdraw() function in the contract allows potential unauthorized script upgrades.

findings.title: Unprotected mint function
findings.description: The mint function is unprotected, allowing anyone to mint tokens without restrictions.

findings.title: Unprotected setCost function
findings.description: The setCost function is unprotected and can be exploited by an attacker.

findings.title: Unprotected setmaxMintAmount function
findings.description: The setmaxMintAmount function is unprotected and can be exploited by an attacker to manipulate the mint amount.

findings.title: Unprotected setmaxMintPerWallet function
findings.description: The setmaxMintPerWallet function is public and can be called by anyone, allowing them to set the maximum mint per wallet without any restrictions.

findings.title: Unprotected setMaxSupply function
findings.description: The setMaxSupply function is public and can be called by anyone, allowing an attacker to set the maximum supply of tokens.

findings.title: Unprotected setBaseURI function
findings.description: The setBaseURI function is public and can be called by anyone, allowing unauthorized users to modify the base URI.

findings.title: Unprotected setBaseExtension function
findings.description: The setBaseExtension function is unprotected and can be called by anyone, potentially leading to unauthorized changes to the base extension.

findings.title: Unprotected pause function
findings.description: The pause function can be called by anyone without any restrictions.

findings.title: Unprotected whitelistUsers function
findings.description: The whitelistUsers function is accessible to anyone and lacks access control, allowing unauthorized users to modify the whitelist.

findings.title: Unprotected setOnlyWhitelisted function
findings.description: The setOnlyWhitelisted function is unprotected and can be exploited by unauthorized users.

findings.title: Unprotected withdraw function
findings.description: The withdraw function does not have any access control or validation checks, allowing unauthorized users to withdraw funds.
